p: It has been reported that NF-κB, AP-1, and IRF3 are the key transcriptional factors in TLR4 signaling. Nuclear translocation of these transcription factors initiates the transcription of genes encoding proinflammatory mediators and cytokines. 33 As shown in Figure 6A and B, nuclear protein levels of IRF3, NF-κB heterodimer components (p65 and p50), and one of the AP-1 components (c-Jun) were markedly increased 60 min after LPS treatment. DCEO treatment inhibited the increment of nuclear IRF3, p65, p50, and c-Jun. Immunofluorescence staining of p65 confirmed the inhibitory effect of DCEO on NF-κB nuclear localization ( Figure 7).
